website_summaries.verdict: If all you have to till is a small area, this tool is convenient and easy to use. But don't expect it to manage large gardens or thick, rocky soil.
pros: Suitable for small areas like flower beds, and handy for weeding
Blades cultivate 6.3-inch wide and a depth as far down as 6 inches
Telescopic handle is easy to adjust
cons: Not built for large gardens or thick, solid soil
Some durability and longevity concerns, especially if you push it beyond its limits

customer_reviews.title: Have patience and you will be rewarded
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully I have a small vegetable and fruit garden and small planting beds. But, I hate turning them over and mixing in new mulch and compost every year. I finally broke down and picked up this electric rototiller to do some of the churning for me. And a wonderful job it does! The rototiller is light weight but powerful enough to bust through our heavy clay soil up here in the northeast. It will dig down into the soil about 5-6 inches provided you have patience to not try to force it to dig faster. Let the tiller do the work at its pace and you will be happy with the results. I should have gotten this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use this in raised beds that was turned with a shovel. The tines kept stopping while the motor spins and with plastic gears that means it is stripped. Too bad because it was light weight. I'm betting it would have worked with packing peanuts fine, but who needs to till packing peanuts. Sent back to amazon. Sun Joe should be embarrassed.
customer_reviews.author: John Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Not good around rocks
customer_reviews.text: I own the larger version and thought I would give the smaller one a try. I like the smaller model but realized it can only be used in soft (no clay), rock-free dirt. See my pics for when you have rocks in the mix. I had to bring out the bigger one to finish the job which had no issues with the rocks.
customer_reviews.author: GLB

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!!!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know if this was the right thing for me to do. Could a 75 year old woman use this tiller? Well guess what. It is so easy to use, I volunteered to help a neighbor get her flower beds ready. I am so glad I got this little guy. And the price was just right.
customer_reviews.author: Exmartian

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I have a different problem than many people. I can afford any labor-saving tool, but I have no place to put them. Following drainage work I needed to plant grass seed. Way too much raking etc. imvolved. Renting a cultivator is a project by itself....Searched on Amazon, found this little beauty for "light" jobs If t didn't wor, I would nt be "out" much money. It does the job!. Light easy to use, excellent for tilling bare spots. We used it on dried, packed down earth and it performed well. We were just tilling down an inch or so for planting grass seed. Just the thing, and you can hang it up on a hook in garaga..
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J. Britt

customer_reviews.title: Great cultivator.
customer_reviews.text: I love this cultivator. I've been using it to prepare my perennial beds for planting. I have used it several times over the weeks to dig compost in and to loosen the soil. I will be using it more this spring to dig in the leaves I have broadcast over the beds and to dig in more soil amendments. It is light and easy to use. Weeds and viney things do wind around the tiller blades and have to pulled out eventually but I don't think there is way this wouldn't happen given the way it works. I am quite pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John StrobelMark Mullis

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a perfect solution to dig shallow trenches to bury some garden hose for a sprinkler system. First 15' worked perfectly. Gave us about 2" deep and we were able to cover the hose nicely. 2nd 12' never got done. It started making noise. Sounded like a bearing burning up. But whatever it was it wouldn't dig at all. It would spin in the air but when you set it down, it stopped. I've seen light duty items before but this is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: DanFfx

customer_reviews.title: Can't get the job done
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine after using the larger one for my garden. That one was an awesome workhorse and did an amazing job tilling the dirt. I tried to use this one in smaller areas and was immediately disappointed. The tines clogged with the slightest bit of mud or a small rock. I couldn't get a 5'x2' bed done without cleaning out the tines over a dozen times. It is light and easy to move around and use, but the bottom line is this machine just isn't powerful enough to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: J.Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this piece of junk! I bought 3 separate sunjoe products, a large tiller, a small tiller and an electric pressure washer. In one day two items broke, the small tiller and pressure washer. ( they were not subject to heavy use, just a small lightweight job at home). Unfortunately, it was over a month before I got around to using them, so returns were not an option, only a warranty replacement for both. So, once the new ones show up, I'll have to see if they are also pieces of junk. I thought this brand was supposed to be good quality. I guess not.
customer_reviews.author: Meaty McMeat

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK... and non refundable.
customer_reviews.text: This just doesn’t work because it’s not strong enough to make it through weeds at all. I also tried on just packed dirt to cultivate before planting grass. Did not do a thing—would just get stuck where the cultivator part didn’t move and we’d just hear the buzzing of the engine. Total waste of money. We needed up hand raking the small part to prep for grass with just a hard rake and it was super easy and then we bought another cultivator at Home Depot. Unfortunately this is non refundable tho... so BUYER BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Good Luck Finding an Extension Cord That Fits.
customer_reviews.text: One group of health and safety engineers piles on top of another group to ensure that this product is unusable in California. Cannot use three-prong (grounded) extension cord due to pieces of rubber designed to prevent the use of a grounded cord or adapter. You have to go to The Home Depot and buy a dedicated extension cord and << gasp >> razor away the preventative rubber "safety" features. The device comes with a six INCH cord, so unless you can move your garden over by the outlet . . . . .
customer_reviews.author: Ken Tennen

customer_reviews.title: A Must Tool for a Home Owner or a professional alike
customer_reviews.text: Gives feeling of robustly built although it has a engineering plastic body well covered to avoid any ingress into motor. The power is good enough for ensuring a smoothening of of lumps and mounds in fields and bots we normally come across even in our lawns! A good tool for hand owner I must admit! And not two expensive also! No gas emission and smooth tilling! I only wish the manufacturer has provided a press button on top instead of side of handle bar! It would have been even easier to operate not that present position makes it clumsy but a press button on top would help even a left handed person to use the Tilles with ease .
customer_reviews.author: Himanshu Dalvi

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, but that's not good
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to use and maneuver, but just couldn't get the job done. Clogs quickly with soil. I was trying to do end of season tilling and composting and thought the power tool would save some time over the old hand tool I've previously used. I found this couldn't get though the soil more than about 6in forward at a time before needing to be cleaned of dirt. Went back to old reliable (the hand tool) and had no trouble, even on the beds I hadn't touched yet. If you've got a small garden you can skip this. For a larger garden I imagine the larger machines will be more appropriate anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Bigbobbo85

customer_reviews.title: Defective (Doesn’t “Cultivate”)
customer_reviews.text: The very first and only time I tried to use it, it made a loud hum from the electric motor and at first the wheel spun, but as soon as you try to till the soil with it, it stops spinning and just makes a loud hum. The box it cam in looked as if it was maybe a prior return that was sent to me as a second hand product even though I ordered it new. Unfortunately, 2 of the 4 Sun Joe products I’ve purchased have turned out defective so I will not recommend or purchase from this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power for such a small machine.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this because I was worried about how much power I would get from it. I've owned two other tillers and this one has plenty of power for it's size. Was also concerned about the long handle - my raised beds are three feet high. That was a little awkward, but all in all, it worked fine and broke up the dried horse apples in the compost with no problems. Like others have said, have something handy to knock out rocks that get stuck in the tines.
customer_reviews.author: xxxxx111000

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and was skeptical. Received it yesterday, took it out of the box and it was ready to go. Plugged it in, pushed the safety button and pulled the trigger. The blades whirled into action. Sounds like a battery powered vacuum cleaner. Went out and tried it on some untilled black dirt. Cut through it like butter. This is not a rototiller folks. You can't put pressure on it and try and till up hard dry clay. Makes short easy work on weeds in gardens and flowerbeds. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: It takes a lot of hand strength to depress the handle, at least according to this old lady. I could only hold it down for 30 seconds without trying very hard to continue squeeze. I handle all normal household and fix it chores and do not consider my hands strength to be weak. Even so, the tines are not sharp and there is very little power. The soil would have to be very soft for these tines to sink into the soil because they have absolutely no bite on firm, yet not solidified, soil.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia R.

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight and maneuverable!
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted a smaller sized tiller for my 12 X 16 ft. vegetable garden for years. After researching several options, I bought the Sun Joe and couldn't be happier! It is electric, so make sure you have a decent length extension cord on hand! I'm petite, but can lift and maneuver the tiller easily( it weights about twenty pounds) and can get close to and in between my veggie plants easily! The tines will dig down about six inches pulling up weeds! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Joely

customer_reviews.title: Sun Joe Aardvard 2.5 Amp Electric Garden Cultivator
customer_reviews.text: I live in an apartment with a small backyard. At this time, I have 2 raised gardens that, although small, have been a real pain to try and keep out the weeds. I live in South Florida, and our weeds grow 365 days a year. This tiller is perfect for my sized garden beds and easy to use. Although you must use a good extension cord, I have no issues with this tiller. It does the job without a problem. Nice piece of equipment, light-weight, easy to store, and an excellent price!
customer_reviews.author: Velvetouch49

customer_reviews.title: Life saver, time saver
customer_reviews.text: I work with mycology growing edible mushrooms for local farmers markets and I go through a ton of horse manure. With horse manure you need to grind it down and usually people use paddle stirring equipment hooked to a drill bit it works like garbage. I saw this neat unit and let me say it rips apart horse poo all day. I have some of the best ground material for my fungi growth that requires no additional cutting down after mixed. It wakes me hours upon yourself of mixing. It also works in tight area of lawn super well. Powerful enough, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Miksa Solutions

customer_reviews.title: Literally does not work.
customer_reviews.text: The cultivator has almost no torque. Tines will spin in the air but not in or on the ground; I can actually stop the tines with my hand. I opened the cultivator up and discovered the drive gear and the first gear in the gear train don't mate properly -- the gears have way too much play and skip against each other. Spins in the air, loses torque on the lightest load.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Machine tends to get stuck....
customer_reviews.text: I love to work outdoors and making sure that my plants gets all the necessary nutrients to make them grow and look nice. Unfortunately, this machine is good for perhaps small areas. The tiller wheels seem to get stuck and don't spin quite a bit. In my opinion, I don't believe this machine has the adequate amount of power needed for tilling dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Ramon S.

customer_reviews.title: Undergroubd
customer_reviews.text: Pushibg the buttob to start the Cultivator is ibcobceiebt. Simply pressibg the trigger should sufficice.. It oulls tii much ib obe direction. Chabging the spare habfle is a struggle Putting the equipnebt back into the container is an effort. the price is alright. habgibfibf the variable habdle is a struggle.
customer_reviews.author: Joesph Vella

customer_reviews.title: Easy to do business with.
customer_reviews.text: The item came in a plain cardboard box and the handle did not extend. I contacted the manufacture and they sent out a new in the box item with an RMA to send the defective one back to them. They were easy to do business with and I would recommend ordering directly through them.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Osbeck

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product, do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: First one didn't work at all. I could grab the blades with my bare hand and stop them. I called and they promptly sent another which worked better but better meaning at least the blades turned. We have a tiny little garden space, maybe 4'X15'. Couldn't do it so I threw it in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Candee

customer_reviews.title: Really good for small weeding around garden
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for a couple of weeks now and it does well. It is more of a electric rake/hoe than tiller. I use it to destroy weeds around my garden and does an excellent job. Does get tangled from time to time and will get hot around the motor housing after extended use. But does it's job.
customer_reviews.author: TTkk1

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller
customer_reviews.text: Love this little thing. We had some real hard ground to turn up so we can put a stone patio near our garden. A golf ball size rock will jam it but when it does you just put it on hard ground and pull it backwards to dislodge the rock. It mixed up our manure and topsoil beautifully. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: redhorse

customer_reviews.title: It is a good buy.
customer_reviews.text: The Ardvark is a bit heavy to be easily steered between plant rows. It would be better if the blades were sharpened. They collect the vegetation around the cutting head and stops the tilling. I sharpened the blades. That allowed it to chop the weeds instead of pulling them.
customer_reviews.author: Leroy C. Reid

customer_reviews.title: A great little tiller
customer_reviews.text: It takes time to break up grass covered soil, but works fast on ground that has already been worked. The only thing I don't like is having to press two buttons in different places at the same time to get it running.
customer_reviews.author: H. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Five Minutes
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this thing. It worked for maybe five minutes to till up some ground around a flagpole for me to make a flower bed and it quickly died right after. I am beyond the 30 days to return it and am so bummed because I really liked this thing. My Dad is a technician and checked it all out only to analyze that the motor went bad. There was no way to fix it. I may order another in hopes I just got a lemon, but I wish I could get refunded for it. If I do buy a second one and the motor doesn't go bad I'll update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This tiller is easily controlled around existing plants
customer_reviews.text: I have both a self-propelled front tine tiller and a Mantis tiller. Bought the Sun Joe to do flower beds. Just arrived today, and I did our sun garden bed that's about 20' x 20' in less than 1/2 hour. This tiller is easily controlled around existing plants. Doesn't throw dirt everywhere. Not for breaking up new soil to plant a garden (that's why I have large tiller), but incredible for smaller areas! Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Fox

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what other say it is
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little, lightweight tiller to use in a small garden area. If you are looking for something to till up compact dirt this is not the tiller for you. It works best in loose soil period. Anything other than that and if you apply to much pressure, it stalls. We use for small garden areas and raised beds which it seems to be well suited for.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light, cheap, effective.  Wat do you want?
customer_reviews.text: I love this little tiller! It’s lightweight and does what it’s supposed to. I’m a graduate of the Mantis, which was great ,but couldn’t stand up to what we required. This baby gets right in ther, tears up topsoil and weed, and makes it possible for these geezers to garden!
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE, LOVE, LOVE THIS LITTLE TILLER!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This tiller is just straight up amazing! I LOVE IT! Would totally recommend! Great little unit!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small suburban lawn and the tiller didn't even last long enough to complete tilling the entire lawn before it stopped working. The motor runs but the blades stopped turning. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Great Cultivator for Raised bed Garden
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small cultivator to work in my raised bed garden, this works great! As stated by other reviews, this is not for heavy duty tilling of the soil. I have good soil in my garden, easy to work. Super simple to use, take your time, it will do the job. Just what I needed for my garden!
customer_reviews.author: Marla Kreider

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Although cheap, not worth the money. Purchased in November to "edge" flower beds around house. Spring has come so I decided to get started putting new pine straw down. Used edger to trim where grass was growing into flower beds, then follow up with this tiller to remove grass from "inside" the edged line. Very soft dirt, just grass. No roots or anything. Got about 40 feet completed before the head stopped spinning. Apparently the gears stripped out. Looking to see if still under warranty since it's been too long to send back through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this product July 2 and weren’t quite ready to do our project. We just opened it today and started using it on our project and before getting through half of our project the motor burned out on it. It literally started smoking on us. We only had 100 ft.2 to till up and the ground was soft. There was only a few hard places but not enough to put any pressure on the motor. Of course it’s past the 30 days return time so it’s sad that it didn’t even last halfway through our project.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Amador

customer_reviews.title: Works great for small areas
customer_reviews.text: Works great for smaller areas. Used it for a small color strip along the driveway. It takes a little practice & I got some pretty sore arm muscles but I'll use it again to prep for spring planting.
customer_reviews.author: napawardlaw

customer_reviews.title: Sticks and stones
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect for what I needed it to do. However small stones and other objects to get caught and stops the machine. If there is some way to fix that I would enjoy this product better.
customer_reviews.author: Earl R. Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Good for small garden.
customer_reviews.text: Works just as I thought it would. Excellent for mixing in compost, manure or any soil additive to the soil prior to planting. I raise tomatoes.. I hated mixing - turning over the soil with a shovel each year. make sure you clean the blades & coat with light oil preservative when you put it up.
customer_reviews.author: william h.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is powerless and wouldn’t even scratch unless I held it up where it barely touch dirt then would stop as soon as I let it down. Would not ever recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN

customer_reviews.title: A nice addition to my garden tools
customer_reviews.text: My garden is about 10’ by 20’ and it’s perfect for getting ready for spring. Love this toy. It does stop when rocks get stuck or weeds wrap around the blades.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Unit Failed- Stopped after 3- ten minute uses
customer_reviews.text: Unit smelled, like it was getting 'Hot' after the first 10 minute use. After the third ten- minute use it started to slow down and finally 'Stopped"! I used a 15-foot #14 Extension cord and the soil was primarily wood chips mixed wit dirt!
customer_reviews.author: Tony DiVincenzo

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: It is really hard to rate something if I never used it due to its defectiveness. The adjustment handle failed to work. I was really dissapointed as I wanted to use it to cultivate my garden. The product should be checked before it's sent out to the customer.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Hecker

customer_reviews.title: Great for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Great for a small area. We used it in small flower beds. It worked fine there. I would not recommend it for oa large area. Buy a bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: How does one return an item.
customer_reviews.text: Upon arrival, we tried to use the tiller but after 45 minutes it stopped working. We let it cool and tried again but it still did not work properly. We would like to return it but have not been able to get a return mail label. I would appreciate help in obtaining a return mail label.
customer_reviews.author: btw1

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Well used it twice works great,going to take me awhile to break up soil in front yard a work in progress. Didn’t realize soil can get so compact.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tool for me!!!!’n
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best little tool ever for my garden. Saves my back!!!!!! I would recommend this for anyone with back issues when in garden!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Sun joe
customer_reviews.text: My father in law loves this its his 3 one he is 80 years but nothing stops him he uses it all the time in his flower beds and in the garden ty
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Kendall

customer_reviews.title: No Power
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. This unit is totally useless as it has no power. I had planned several small projects but this unit stops turning as soon as it contacts the soil. The only way the unit turns is if it is held in the air. Unfortunately I already disposed of the packaging so I am not able to return this useless device.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie, NC

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Price
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the Garden Cultivator was doing well until it wouldn't start back up after being in use. I gave it rest periods after using it but the final rest time it wouldn't start back up until the next day. I will be using it again very soon and will see how it does then.
customer_reviews.author: Sshorty

customer_reviews.title: It works for light jobs
customer_reviews.text: Being a woman who wants to till gardens, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Douris

customer_reviews.title: great little workhorse.  lightweight; but suprisingly powerful.
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis & debilitating joint/muscle pain. This little guy has made it possible for me to continue some level my gardening hobby. I would not have be able to otherwise. It's lightweight, light duty, but it was still more powerful that I expected. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: R. Newman

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this little tiller to use in my garden to go in between plants. To help keep down on the weeds and let me tell you within 5 minutes of running this thing the motor on the tiller started smoking and just plain quit. Mind you the soil its tilling is already loose and not hard at all bought it in hopes of saving some time weeding the garden. Save your money and don't purchase one of these hunks of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Robert Smoot

customer_reviews.title: Performs as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I had to revisit my previous comments because the tiller did not last 1 season. Worked well initially but the blades have become loose (gears slipping). Looks to be a quality issue.
customer_reviews.author: GDS

customer_reviews.title: only for soft dirt
customer_reviews.text: nice little product. but only for soft dirt with no vegetation. any small rocks or grasses locks up the rotors causing the internal gears to break. had 2 of these units, both lasted for about 15 minutes of use. customer service told me these units are not for hard or compact dirt, only for mixing up already broken up beds.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Trebotich

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing product
customer_reviews.text: After i got my product i was hoping to till a small spot for a little garden. First the safety button would not work, however, the item did power up. The most disappointing of all was that it would not till anything. I had to scrape the grass, then it still would not till the soil. It seemed like the blades were dull. I guess it would work in sand.
customer_reviews.author: neatfrk101

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, but good power.
customer_reviews.text: We like it very much. The most lightweight "cultivator" I could find. Nevertheless, it has plenty of power for churning dirt, and the 6 inch swath is great for getting around plants. The only slight difficulty is that stones grab the tines often and stop the tiller, but that's a problem for all of them, anyway. The stones are easily removed. Comes with simple instructions, only thing to install is the black handle.
customer_reviews.author: Luis F. Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy an electric tiller
customer_reviews.text: This item was lightly used in flowerbeds, and started smoking during the first 10 minutes of use. I'll be buying a gas powered one.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Michna

customer_reviews.title: useless
customer_reviews.text: Received this today and took it out to my garden, it would not even break up a clump of dirt. If you put any downward presser on the blades that would stop. I am returning and based on the layers of tape on the package I don't think I am the first one.
customer_reviews.author: Wizard

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: Blades jammed on a small rock during first use. Now blades won't spin
customer_reviews.author: William J Justice Sr

customer_reviews.title: It works way better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This arrived today, It works way better than I expected. Absolutely am delighted perfect for fixing up my flower beds...if it would of worked half as good I would have been happy. I did in 2 hrs more than i did the last few days by hand.
customer_reviews.author: joseph michlig

customer_reviews.title: motor not very strong
customer_reviews.text: good for small or raised bed but if you have any roots or mulch the motor does not have enough power to run through them and stop working. Clean soil this is a nice unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy return!
customer_reviews.text: Although product arrived quickly, unfortunately it was defective, returned product.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra McFarland

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: I loved how lightweight and maneuverable it was but unfortunately after limited use on the first day it quit working! Unable to get it to work again. Will be returning!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Jaross

customer_reviews.title: it's ok
customer_reviews.text: not for hard packed soil. ideal for a garden area with looser soil.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn M. Champagne

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: it keeps getting stuck with something. Im constantly removing debris from the teeth. takes the job twice longer.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Online issues!
customer_reviews.text: Product came broken. I called Manufacturer and they said they would send new parts to fix issue. Been weeks now and nothing yet. Becoming skeptical about ordering online.
customer_reviews.author: Chiz

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk.....stopped working after the third time I used it. Used it on soft soil to cultivate some potting soil into the existing soil. Third time I used and no juice. Tried different cords, different outlets, used a current detector and no juice going to the motor. Guessing the switch is broken. I expected better from this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: From A+ to and E in one summer~!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace the one I had for a long time and worked well. However, this one only worked through two uses and then it started not turning properly. Customer Service was great and said they would replace it. But then it was on back order....and now a month after saying they would ship it again I am still without it....and summer is almost over. I am very unhappy that I have to call again to ask where the replacement is.
customer_reviews.author: lori

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to use for weed control in my vegetable garden. The shipping was very fast as expected. I have a large gas tiller that I use to initially till the garden to prepare it for planting. I purchased this tiller to use between the rows to control weeds. My garden is 8 foot by 20 feet so not overly large. I used this tiller 3 times and it quit. I guess I could understand if it was the first time tilling the whole garden, but I was using this small tiller on already tilled dirt....not hard to till at all!!! I am very disappointed!!! I would not purchase from this company again!
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for a small garden
customer_reviews.text: Came fully assembled, a plus. I was surprised how well this small cultivator worked. Took me 10-15 minutes to work my whole garden (it's not very big). By hand it would take me about an hour and a half with a shovel to turn the soil. It does get clogged if there's a lot of grass but then it's just a small machine. You don't need to use a lot of pressure on it. Just turn it on and let it bite into the soil. This was a great value for the money. I'm very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rouse

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Designed very poorly---every rock and pebble in my garden got stuck between the blades and the body of the product-stalling the motor. Also it doesn't have the horsepower to handle clay so if you have hard soil forget about it..is a 55 dollar rototiller too good to be true (Yes) it is :(
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S.

customer_reviews.title: A good compact cultivator
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and easy to use. If you have a small garden, this is the tool for you.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: No longer works after less than a year
customer_reviews.text: After about 10 uses and storing all winter it only half works. It like stalls so you have to turn it off one back on to get it to work
customer_reviews.author: Heather Gibbens

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: it is a piece of junk. tines strioed out in loose soilmaking it completly useless.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Little Garden Projects
customer_reviews.text: This little guy packs a punch. It works great for small backyard gardening! Would recommend to all ages and genders!
customer_reviews.author: Blakelee

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Used product once in flower beds and it acts like gears are stripped Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Kellie Charley

customer_reviews.title: Great for loose soil mixing.
customer_reviews.text: This tiller works fine for small jobs like mixing compost or fertilizer into raised beds. If you proceed slowly without forcing the machine it will do a decent job in soil that is already loose. It is relatively light weight, but somewhat cumbersome to move around. This is not a tool for breaking new ground or sod to start a garden, but after the ground has been dug up by a powerful gas tiller the Aardvark is great for weeding and mixing compost into the top few inches.
customer_reviews.author: Robert King

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use Works Great
customer_reviews.text: We love our cultivator. It works so well for turning the soil in our garden spot and for weeding between times. Much more cost effective than a tiller. Our garden space has been well established for several years. This may not be the best option if this is your first time digging out a garden patch - have someone till it for you initially, but then use this afterwords. It is very easy to hold and use and makes loosening soil a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Looked all over the NET to find this tiller at a local supply house. Home Depo, Sears, Walmart, and others claimed to carry the tiller, but not one actually carried this brand or tiller. Bait and switch on the internet I guess. Went ahead and went through Amazon. It arrived in the three days as promised. It worked great. Easy to use right out of the box. Would highly recommend this tiller to anybody with a medium size garden.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Slade

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable to use.
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable to use . . . hard to keep safety switch button pushed in and angle of handle grip is not user friendly. Also, the belt(?) slips a lot making it a bit aggravating to use. It eventually gets the job done, but would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: oldsnort

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The product claims to be able to cultivate 6" but I couldn't get 1/4". The blades stopped turning in a well tilled garden soil every second or so. Was finally able to dig 2" deep after 5 minutes in one spot and I mean 1 spot. Very disappointed with product and description. Will see how customer support goes!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality tool DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Product does not work as described. I couldn't get it to turn over my freshly tilled soil. Even tried starting it and get it to full speed then place it on the soil and it would just stall. Could be a bad motor or more likely, just a bad product. Also this is non returnable. Make sure you read the details before you buy this.
customer_reviews.author: LeVauer Andrews

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful machine for light duty work such as fixing lawn ...
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful machine for light duty work such as fixing lawn patches, flower beds or other landscape work. It is very light and easy to maneuver. Also very easy for a female to work with. Not recommended for cultivating, farming or large land work.
customer_reviews.author: Naveen K. Mital

customer_reviews.title: Love the Aardvark
customer_reviews.text: Have a small area or tight spot to cultivate? Then this is the tool for you. I Love the unit. Lots of power, small space, tills to 6" and cost is small. I used the unit to cultivate a 3' x 40' area of fairly tough ground and it worked like a champ. Only thing that stopped this unit was the stones it brought up and were wedged under the housing - simple to clear and on it went again! Would purchase again in an instant - really!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised. I bought it to till between rows in my vegetable garden. It worked very well. More power than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2 x’s used
customer_reviews.text: Used twice in 2 years & the 3rd time the motor locked up. Garage kept so dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Honest

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: Made my 1st vegetable garden this year and I loved this! It’s fun to use too! I was laughing like a little kid
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tiller
customer_reviews.text: I love this little tool. I have a larger rototiller but I wanted something to get in smaller places to help with weeding. This is the best tool I have in my garden arsenal. It is lightweight and easy to maneuver. Does a great job. Saves my hands from weeding and gets rid of all the roots too !
customer_reviews.author: Mary Post

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It barely scratches the surface. But it is ok for my needs. Not a lot of power here.
customer_reviews.author: S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller
customer_reviews.text: Great for the garden to break up soil between rows to hill up the plants and no messing with gas and oil.
customer_reviews.author: Truck guy

customer_reviews.title: worked awesome in good clean dirt
customer_reviews.text: worked awesome in good clean dirt. I used it in soft dirt that had many weeds and had to unplug and clean it out numerous times do to it heating up. it was nice to have something so compact for my wife's garden boxes. over all very pleased. just know your applications and it's limitations.
customer_reviews.author: S Reed - MI

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was great for my flower beds. Easy to assemble & use.
customer_reviews.author: peggy boismenue

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough
customer_reviews.text: It’s light weight but not strong enough to till my ground. I think it’s made for ground that is already soft and broken up.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. Did what I brought it for digging a shadow trench.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance, will not dig as a tiller should
customer_reviews.text: When I tried to till with this tiller the tines would stop and not cut the dirt. No power at all was transfered from the electric motor to the tines, the tines would just slip and stop with the motor still running (slipping). Wish I could send it back! Not good for tilling dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: terrible product
customer_reviews.text: this product is useless. you cannot apply any pressure or the belt will burn and not turn the gears. i regret buying this product
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Makes easy work of tilling!
customer_reviews.text: We used in our vegetable garden, then took it out to our flower garden. It made such easy work of turning over the dirt. Our grass and weeds were quite thick and this went right through it. We absolutely love it! Priced right; works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Sun Joe TJ599E Aardvark 2.5-Amp Electric Garden Cultivator
product_meta.description: Color:GreenThanks to this easy to use electric cultivator, you can quickly and easily cultivate your garden and get ready for planting. The Aardvark TJ599E electric cultivator from Sun Joe packs a powerful punch for quick soil turnover. The Sun Joe Aardvark TJ599E cultivates up to 6-inches deep with its four durable steel tines. The TJ599E garden cultivator is powered by a reliable 2.5 AMP electric motor, which means no more messing with gas and oil. Simply plug in your Aardvark electric cultivator and start cultivating instantly. The Aardvark TJ599E comes with a full two year warranty. Enrich your gardening experience with the Aardvark electric cultivator from Sun Joe.
feature_bullets: Versatile: small gardens and flower beds
Powerful: 2.5-Amp motor cultivates up to 6.3" Wide x 6" Deep
Comfort: Ergonomic handle design with adjustable telescoping shaft

We’ve got you covered!: your new cultivator is backed by the snow Joe + Sun Joe customer promise. We will warrant New, powered products for two years from the date of purchase. No questions asked. Contact snow Joe + Sun Joe customer Support at 1-866-766-9563 for further assistance.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
